contract_identification.contract_name: Enforcement Systems Operations and Maintenance Support Services (ESOMSS)

client_and_agency.client: Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

scope_and_work_type: Providing DHS support for PTA, PIA, SORN, and other privacy compliance documentation
Modernizing EAGLE and Notice to Appear (NTA) systems using biometric data
Applications interface with other DHS and Law Enforcement branches
Use of open-source software and technologies
Application development using Java and Agile processes
Responsible for more than 40 named complex applications critical for enforcement operations at the Southwest Border under the ICE Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) division
Forms and Correspondence Systems for Users
Support complex environment with over 7.9k+ Law Enforcement Officers and ERO employee users in 200 domestic and 25 overseas locations
Ensuring ICE ERO systems maintain privacy of PII data
Redesigning event-centric processing model using events from initial subject encounter
Agile DME and O&M support of 25 user-centric, mission-critical enterprise ICE Enforcement Systems running more than 40 applications operated within AWS GovCloud East and West
Applications use biometrics as primary identification during booking process
Created state-of-the-art AWS architecture using cloud native services, event-driven architecture, and serverless lambda functions
teaming_and_delivery: Supporting Java, Oracle, AWS architecture, and other technologies
Staffed over 100 personnel within 60 days of award
5 Agile DevSecOps teams with 13 FTEs per team
performance_and_quality: Performing security control design and annual assessment, assessing DHS 4300A and NIST 800-53 controls
Automated processes to improve data quality and outcomes
Following ICE's System Lifecycle Management (SLM) process and related guidelines
Applying Agile, AWS cloud hosting, and DevSecOps
Complying with FAR and HSAR privacy regulations
Implemented digital workflow for forms and correspondence
Setting up Functional Quality Testing (FQT), UAT, and QA environments
compliance_and_standards: DHS 4300A Sensitive Systems policies and requirements
Ensured FDCC/USGCB compliance for software installations
Maintained security posture and compliance with DHS 4300A, NIST 800-53

sources: DOS INR Intelligence Development and Enterprise Applications 09-2024.docx
scope_and_work_type: Harmonia provides the DOS INR and other Department intelligence stakeholders with a comprehensive IT solution design and development. We identify, analyze, integrate, deploy, and maintain technical capabilities essential for establishing the full suite of enterprise applications to meet the current and evolving INR diplomatic and intelligence mission needs. Our services encompass agile software development, program risk and requirements management, and IT operations services to operate and maintain both existing and newly integrated technology solutions.
